items.title: Android: External Write Permissions
items.body:
I've been trying to read and write to a text file from Android studio, and keep getting the "Permission denied" exception. I've read through the different posts,and still can't seem to solve it.

My code: public void buttonSave(View view) { //File directory = new File(path); File directoryFile = new File(Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory().getAbsolutePath(), ""); directoryFile.mkdirs(); File file = new File(directoryFile, "savefile.txt"); try { file.createNewFile(); } catch (IOException e) {;}

    eV = (EditText)findViewById(R.id.editText_box);
   String[] editTextValue = eV.getText().toString().split(" ");

  Save(file, editTextValue);
}
public void Save(File file, String[] data){
   FileOutputStream foe = null;
    Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), Integer.toString(data.length), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();

   try {
       foe = new FileOutputStream(file);
   }catch (FileNotFoundException e) {Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), "error", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();}

        try {

            for (int i=0; i<data.length; i++){
                foe.write(data[i].getBytes());
                if (i<data.length){
                    foe.write("\n".getBytes());
                }

            }
        }catch (IOException e) {};

    try {
        foe.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {};
}

And my manifest file:

    <manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    package="home.learningapp2">
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" /> 
   <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE"/>

Any suggestions? It doesn't work on the emulator or when I run it on my phone.

Notice that collapsed box shows only ellipses("...") and are placed in front of method declaration. But when I try to follow the same, I do not get the desired result. See below screenshot:

How do I achieve the same result? Is there any trick that I am missing here?

items.title: How can you conform protocol variables' set & get?
items.body:
I'm playing around with protocols and how to conform to them.

protocol Human {    
    var height: Int {get set}    
}

struct boy : Human { 
    var height: Int  {return 5} // error!
}

I'm trying to learn different ways that I can implement set and get. However the code above throws the following error:

type 'boy' does not conform to protocol 'Human'

However writing as below won't have any errors:

struct boy : Human { 
    var height = 5 // no error
}

I don't understand the difference nor what exactly needs to be implemented when you can also set a variable. I looked into different questions and tutorials but they all just write and go without any deeper explanation.

items.title: Converting PNG image to ZPL code
items.body:
I need to print a PNG image onto a label with a ZPL printer. The idea is to convert the PNG image to a monochrome one and then generate the necessary ZPL code with the image data to print the image.

After some googling and coding, I have a piece of code that does just that. The generated ZPL code seems fine on labelary (http://labelary.com).

The code for generating the ZPL code was mostly taken from here --> How to optimize ASCII HEX for BMP to ZPL as using in Labelary

Unfortunately, when trying to print a label with the generated ZPL code, it comes out like this: Not supposed to look like this

Image should look like this: ImageToConvert

The code that i use is this:

static void Main(string[] args)
    {

        // 1. Convert Image to monochrome bmp
        string bitmapFilePath = @"somepath.bmp";
        Bitmap imageToConvert = new Bitmap(bitmapFilePath);
        var rectangle = new Rectangle(0, 0, imageToConvert.Width, imageToConvert.Height);
        Bitmap monochromeImage = imageToConvert.Clone(rectangle, PixelFormat.Format1bppIndexed);

        // Mirror image
        monochromeImage.RotateFlip(RotateFlipType.Rotate180FlipX);

        // Save mono image            
        monochromeImage.Save("somePathMono.bmp", ImageFormat.Bmp);

        // 2. Convert to ZPL
        ConvertImage();   

    }

    public static void ConvertImage()
    {
        string bitmapFilePath = "somePathMono.bmp";
        int w, h;
        Bitmap b = new Bitmap(bitmapFilePath);
        w = b.Width; h = b.Height;
        byte[] bitmapFileData = System.IO.File.ReadAllBytes(bitmapFilePath);
        int fileSize = bitmapFileData.Length;

        int bitmapDataOffset = int.Parse(bitmapFileData[10].ToString()); ;
        int width = w; // int.Parse(bitmapFileData[18].ToString()); ;
        int height = h; // int.Parse(bitmapFileData[22].ToString()); ;
        int bitsPerPixel = int.Parse(bitmapFileData[28].ToString()); 
        int bitmapDataLength = bitmapFileData.Length - bitmapDataOffset;
        double widthInBytes = Math.Ceiling(width / 8.0);

        while (widthInBytes % 4 != 0)
        {
            widthInBytes++;
        }

        // Copy over the actual bitmap data without header data            
        byte[] bitmap = new byte[bitmapDataLength];

        Buffer.BlockCopy(bitmapFileData, bitmapDataOffset, bitmap, 0, bitmapDataLength);           

        // Invert bitmap colors
        for (int i = 0; i < bitmapDataLength; i++)
        {
            bitmap[i] ^= 0xFF;
        }             

        // Create ASCII ZPL string of hexadecimal bitmap data
        string ZPLImageDataString = BitConverter.ToString(bitmap);            
        ZPLImageDataString = ZPLImageDataString.Replace("-", string.Empty);

        // Add new line every 1023 chars characters
        string ZPLImageDataStringWithNewLine = SpliceText(ZPLImageDataString, 1023);            

        // Create ZPL command to print image
        string ZPLCommand = string.Empty;

        ZPLCommand += "^XA";
        ZPLCommand += "^FO20,20";
        ZPLCommand +=
        "^GFA," +
        bitmapDataLength.ToString() + "," +
        bitmapDataLength.ToString() + "," +
        widthInBytes.ToString() + "," +
        System.Environment.NewLine +
        ZPLImageDataStringWithNewLine;

        ZPLCommand += "^XZ";

        System.IO.StreamWriter sr = new System.IO.StreamWriter("zplCodePath", false, System.Text.Encoding.Default);

        sr.Write(ZPLCommand);
        sr.Close();       
    }

    public static string SpliceText(string text, int lineLength)
    {
        return Regex.Replace(text, "(.{" + lineLength + "})", "$1" + Environment.NewLine);
    }

We use the Zebra ZT 410 printer

Can someone help me figure out what the problem could be? I'm out of ideas at this point.

Thanks!

items.body_markdown:
Dear devs at stackoverflow,

I would really appreciate your help with a tricky problem I am not able to resolve while unit testing one of my Spring MVC controllers.

The entire code repository can be found here: https://github.com/peerpub/peerpub

**Environment:**

 * Java 8
 * Maven 3.5
 * Spring Boot 2.0.1
 * Spring Framework 5.0.4
 * Thymeleaf 3
 * JUnit 5 + Mockito

**Problem description:**

While trying to come up with detailed tests for [`DocTypeAdminCtrl.java`](https://github.com/peerpub/peerpub/blob/oliver_dtsvc/src/main/java/de/fzj/peerpub/doc/doctype/DocTypeAdminCtrl.java) using a unit test approach with Mockito/MockMVC, I am not able to bind data based on a `Map`, while simple `String` and `Boolean` work just fine. The same is happening when I try to use this in my full-stack integration tests (already tried that).

_While using the application via the web browser, this problem does not appear, so this seems to be entirely testing related._

All tests named `editPost...()` in [`DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java`](https://github.com/peerpub/peerpub/blob/oliver_dtsvc/src/test/java/de/fzj/peerpub/doc/doctype/DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java) fail. Example log excerpt from `mvn test`:
 
    Tests run: 7, Failures: 3, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.437 sec <<< FAILURE! - in de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest
    editPostFormSuccess  Time elapsed: 0.103 sec  <<< FAILURE!
    java.lang.AssertionError: Status expected:<302> but was:<200>
    at de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.editPostFormSuccess(DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java:148)

    editPostFormNonMatchingNames  Time elapsed: 0.046 sec  <<< FAILURE!
    java.lang.AssertionError: Model attribute 'doctype' expected:   <DocTypeForm(name=vfAtXQ, displayName=01p14G7v22, system=false, multiDoc=true, attributes=[6Vuzhn, zKXSTl], mandatory={6Vuzhn=null, zKXSTl=true}, defaults={6Vuzhn=, zKXSTl=sooeOYb6Ld})> but was:<DocTypeForm(name=vfAtXQ, displayName=01p14G7v22, system=false, multiDoc=true, attributes=[6Vuzhn, zKXSTl], mandatory=null, defaults=null)>
    at de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.editPostFormNonMatchingNames(DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java:165)

    editPostFormExceptionDTO  Time elapsed: 0.041 sec  <<< FAILURE!
    java.lang.AssertionError: Model attribute 'doctype' expected:<DocTypeForm(name=GPzldO, displayName=mIV7Utta1Y, system=false, multiDoc=false, attributes=[8GsYhQ, bZGkd2], mandatory={8GsYhQ=null, bZGkd2=true}, defaults={8GsYhQ=SfoDlEiYAz, bZGkd2=k4uaLxx8yf})> but was:<DocTypeForm(name=GPzldO, displayName=mIV7Utta1Y, system=false, multiDoc=false, attributes=[8GsYhQ, bZGkd2], mandatory=null, defaults=null)>
     at  de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.editPostFormExceptionDTO(DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java:210)

Please note that the properties `mandatory` and `defaults` always get set to `null`, while present in the model. I verified that even my custom validator [DocTypeFormValidator.java](https://github.com/peerpub/peerpub/blob/oliver_dtsvc/src/main/java/de/fzj/peerpub/doc/doctype/DocTypeFormValidator.java) is not seeing this data. This is also causing my `editPostFormSuccess` test to fail: as the properties are set to `null`, the validator is unhappy and the binding result contains errors.

As I unit/integration tested any kind of stuff used by my `DocTypeAdminCtrl.java` I am pretty sure that there must be something missing or wrong either in my controller class or in my test class. 

There could be a bug in the `MockMvcRequestBuilderUtils.postForm()` (see [upstream](https://github.com/f-lopes/spring-mvc-test-utils)), but I actually have no clue how to write an alternate `post()` request with my test data containing `Map` and `List`. Having a look at the `MockHttpServletRequestBuilder` with a debugger, all data seems to be present, including `mandatory` and `defaults`, so this might be a less important thing to examine...?

Some suspicious debug log output lines that caught my attention:

    org.springframework.beans.BeanUtils - No property editor [java.util.MapEditor] found for type java.util.Map according to 'Editor' suffix convention
    org.springframework.core.annotation.AnnotationUtils - Failed to meta-introspect annotation interface org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ModelAttribute: java.lang.NullPointerException

Searching for these errors here on StackOverflow and via Google didn't help much... :-(

**Steps to reproduce:**

Just clone my repo, switch to my feature branch `oliver_dtsvc` and run `mvn test`.

Does anybody out there have a clue? Any help is very much appreciated!
items.title: Unit testing Spring MVC Controller: java.util.Map data not bound
items.body:
Dear devs at stackoverflow,

I would really appreciate your help with a tricky problem I am not able to resolve while unit testing one of my Spring MVC controllers.

The entire code repository can be found here: https://github.com/peerpub/peerpub

Environment:

  • Java 8
  • Maven 3.5
  • Spring Boot 2.0.1
  • Spring Framework 5.0.4
  • Thymeleaf 3
  • JUnit 5 + Mockito

Problem description:

While trying to come up with detailed tests for DocTypeAdminCtrl.java using a unit test approach with Mockito/MockMVC, I am not able to bind data based on a Map, while simple String and Boolean work just fine. The same is happening when I try to use this in my full-stack integration tests (already tried that).

While using the application via the web browser, this problem does not appear, so this seems to be entirely testing related.

All tests named editPost...() in DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java fail. Example log excerpt from mvn test:

Tests run: 7, Failures: 3, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.437 sec <<< FAILURE! - in de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest
editPostFormSuccess  Time elapsed: 0.103 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Status expected:<302> but was:<200>
at de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.editPostFormSuccess(DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java:148)

editPostFormNonMatchingNames  Time elapsed: 0.046 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Model attribute 'doctype' expected:   <DocTypeForm(name=vfAtXQ, displayName=01p14G7v22, system=false, multiDoc=true, attributes=[6Vuzhn, zKXSTl], mandatory={6Vuzhn=null, zKXSTl=true}, defaults={6Vuzhn=, zKXSTl=sooeOYb6Ld})> but was:<DocTypeForm(name=vfAtXQ, displayName=01p14G7v22, system=false, multiDoc=true, attributes=[6Vuzhn, zKXSTl], mandatory=null, defaults=null)>
at de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.editPostFormNonMatchingNames(DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java:165)

editPostFormExceptionDTO  Time elapsed: 0.041 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Model attribute 'doctype' expected:<DocTypeForm(name=GPzldO, displayName=mIV7Utta1Y, system=false, multiDoc=false, attributes=[8GsYhQ, bZGkd2], mandatory={8GsYhQ=null, bZGkd2=true}, defaults={8GsYhQ=SfoDlEiYAz, bZGkd2=k4uaLxx8yf})> but was:<DocTypeForm(name=GPzldO, displayName=mIV7Utta1Y, system=false, multiDoc=false, attributes=[8GsYhQ, bZGkd2], mandatory=null, defaults=null)>
 at  de.fzj.peerpub.doc.doctype.DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.editPostFormExceptionDTO(DocTypeAdminCtrlTest.java:210)

Please note that the properties mandatory and defaults always get set to null, while present in the model. I verified that even my custom validator DocTypeFormValidator.java is not seeing this data. This is also causing my editPostFormSuccess test to fail: as the properties are set to null, the validator is unhappy and the binding result contains errors.

As I unit/integration tested any kind of stuff used by my DocTypeAdminCtrl.java I am pretty sure that there must be something missing or wrong either in my controller class or in my test class.

There could be a bug in the MockMvcRequestBuilderUtils.postForm() (see upstream), but I actually have no clue how to write an alternate post() request with my test data containing Map and List. Having a look at the MockHttpServletRequestBuilder with a debugger, all data seems to be present, including mandatory and defaults, so this might be a less important thing to examine...?

Some suspicious debug log output lines that caught my attention:

org.springframework.beans.BeanUtils - No property editor [java.util.MapEditor] found for type java.util.Map according to 'Editor' suffix convention
org.springframework.core.annotation.AnnotationUtils - Failed to meta-introspect annotation interface org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ModelAttribute: java.lang.NullPointerException

Searching for these errors here on StackOverflow and via Google didn't help much... :-(

Steps to reproduce:

Just clone my repo, switch to my feature branch oliver_dtsvc and run mvn test.

Does anybody out there have a clue? Any help is very much appreciated!

items.title: Angular 5: Execute script successively
items.body:
I am under Angular 5, and Loopback for the backend; I would like to delete items successively.

A user has an account, which can have multiple profiles, which can have multiple works.

I would like, from a given user:

  • Delete all works from all his profiles

  • Then delete his profiles

  • Finally delete his account

(because if I simply delete the account, the profiles and the works remain, nothing is done in cascade)

However, the script is asynchronous and it can happen that Angular tries to delete a work from a profile that does not exist (it can not retrieve the profile's id in order to delete his artworks because this profil was deleted).

So I try the .subscribe (...), the Promise, the .then (...), but I do not understand anything.

For example, here is my main function :

deleteCurrentUser(): void {
        for ( let profil of this.profils )
            this.profilApi.deleteById(profil.id).subscribe((res) => {
                this.log.info("supp profil : res = ", res);
             }, (err) => {
                this.log.error("delete profil err: ", err);
             });

        // Suppression account
        this.accountApi.deleteById(this.currentUser.id).subscribe((res) => {
            this.log.info("supp : res = ", res);
        }, (err) => {
            this.log.error("delete account err: ", err);
        });

      this.accountApi.clearAuth();
      this._router.navigate(['/home']);
    }

Could you help me ?

Thank you in advance ! :)

items.title: Multiple circles filled with linear gradients background
items.body:
I need to achieve this background pattern :

I add to erase some text parts for clarification, ignore my poor Gimp skills

I've been using a div for each circle but it doesn't feel very maintainable neither responsive. I was wondering if there was a pure CSS solution or if I should go for a SVG background.

Here is what I came up with for now : https://jsfiddle.net/ygvdckLf/15/

HTML

<div class="card">
  <div class="circles-container">
    <div class="circle"></div>
    <div class="circle"></div>
    <div class="circle"></div>
    <div class="circle"></div>
  </div>
</div>

SCSS

body {
  height: 100vh;
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
}
.card {
  background: #6ec8d0;
  width: 274px;
  height: 132px;
}

.circles-container {
  position: relative;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.circle {
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 50%;

I've got an anchor tag which has an href, however someone must have put an event listener on because the link doesn't go to the href, but to another location. I've tried everything I know and am out of ideas to understand why this happens.

If I right click the tag, and open in a new tab, the page opens to the URL I want. If I just click the tab, it goes to the wrong page. I've looked at the event listener in dev tools and removing that in dev tools does make my tag use the href, which is great. I just don't know where this is being set. The event listener in dev tools has a hyperlink next to it of "https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.1.1.min.js:formatted" however that brings up the jquery library (I think) and its uglified and not any help.

I've tried clicking through the event listener in dev tools (mainly the handler section) but it hasn't given me any information I need (I might not know where to look exactly, this is a highly nested tree and has tons of info I don't need). I've searched our codebase many times for identifiers to find where an event listener might be getting bound to the element but can't find anything.

I've tried setting an event listener breakpoint in chrome for mouse clicks, but this loads "include.postload.js" which I can't seem to get any useful information from.

Finally, we have this same DOM element and href being built as a header across 3 sites. The other 2 sites also have this event listener on the anchor tag. These other 2 sites work as I'd hoped, and when clicked go to the href. This makes me think there's a chance the issue isn't with the event listener I see, but I'm not sure.

Any info, debugging tips, etc. is greatly appreciated.

items.title: Entity Framework 6: Insert or Update
items.body:
I want to insert or update a row in a table with Entity Framework depending if the primary key (string) already exists in the table.

I am using the following code to do that which I got from here: Insert or update pattern

private void InsertOrUpdate(ServiceMonitoring sm)
{
    try
    {
        using (var context = new MyDBEntities())
        {
            context.Entry(sm).State = sm.serviceName == null ?
                EntityState.Added :
                EntityState.Modified;
            context.SaveChanges();
        }
        log.Info("ServiceMonitoring updated");
    }
    catch (Exception ex)
    {
        log.Error("Error updating ServiceMonitoring");
        log.Debug(ex.Message);
    }

}

It is working fine when the row (e.g. serviceName = "MyService") already exists. Then an UPDATE is performed. But if the row does not exist, the INSERT fails and I get the following error message:

Store update, insert, or delete statement affected an unexpected number of rows (0). Entities may have been modified or deleted since entities were loaded.

Any help is highly appreciated!

items.title: Material Checkboxes not working with their 'checked' derivative
items.body:
I have a table of records where the first cell in each column has a checkbox. when the checkbox is clicked, I store that record's id into an array in typescript:

onCheckboxClick(id) {
  if (this.selectedInvoiceables.indexOf(id) > -1) {
    this.selectedInvoiceables.splice(id, 1);
  } else {
    this.selectedInvoiceables.push(id);
  }
  if (this.selectedInvoiceables.length > 1) {
    this.disableBulkEdit = false;
  } else {
    this.disableBulkEdit = true;
  }
}

and here is the checkbox:

<mat-checkbox
   class="checkbox"
   (change)="onCheckboxClick(invoice.id)"
   id = "invoiceCheckbox{{invoice.id}}"
   [checked]="selectedInvoiceables.indexOf(invoice.id) > -1"
> </mat-checkbox>

So, whenever the checkboxes are clicked, we store the id. And that works fine, however, there seems to be an issue where clicking on one checkbox will deselect another checkbox even though the value is still contained in my selectedInvoiceables array. Is my current check for the [checked] derivative not good enough or being refreshed irregularly?

items.body_markdown:
**This question is an extension of [another question I asked][1] regarding many-to-many relationships in MySQL.**

I currently have 3 tables that I need to link with a 4th intermediary table:

`Stores`, `Products`, and `States`

My intermediary table, `_stores_products_states`, combines the `id` from the other three tables to determine which `product` is sold by which `store` and in which `state`.

Now, as I understand it, I would need to create an entry in `_stores_products_states` for every possible combination of the three, correct? This would lead to thousands of duplicated values in 1-2 of the columns (though never all 3).

For example, if **Best Guy** sells both **GI Bros** and **Darbies** in all 50 states, that would be 100 entries just for those two products. If those products are sold by another store, they too would have 100 entries.

Is this the correct way to implement this kind of relationship?

**EDIT:**
This whole setup is basically just to determine the availability of a particular product. A user will search for a product and receive a list of stores that sell that product in their state.

  [1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49643363/how-to-implement-many-to-many-to-many-database-relationship/49644209?noredirect=1#comment86314254_49644209

The JavaScript code.

const   express = require("express"),
        mongoose = require("mongoose"),
        { execFile} = require("child_process"),

        staffMember = require("./models/staffMember"),
        group = require("./models/group"),
        college = require("./models/college"),
        student = require("./models/student");


function convert3dArrayStringToOjbect(string){
    var arrayPointer1d = -1, arrayPointer2d = -1;
    var arrayCounter2d = -1;
    var array = [];
    //string to array
    for(var i = 0; i < string.length; i++){
        if(string[i] == '['){
            if(arrayPointer1d != -1){
                array.push([]);
                arrayCounter2d++;
                arrayPointer2d = arrayPointer1d;
                arrayPointer1d = -1;
            }
            else{
                arrayPointer1d = i;
            }
        }else if(string[i] == ']'){

            if(arrayPointer1d != -1){
                array[arrayCounter2d].push(eval(string.substring(arrayPointer1d, i + 1)));
                arrayPointer1d = -1;
            }
            else if(arrayPointer2d != -1){
                arrayPointer2d = -1;
            }
        }
    }
    //change 1d arrays to objects
    for(var i = 0; i < array.length; i++){
        for(var t = 0; t < array[i].length; t++){
            array[i][t] = {
                period: array[i][t][0], 
                moduleCode: array[i][t][1], 
                credits: parseInt(array[i][t][2]), 
                name: array[i][t][3]
            };
        }
    }
    if (arrayChecker(array)) return array;
    return false;
}

function arrayChecker(array){
    for(var i = 0; i < array.length; i++){
        for(var t = 0; t < array[i].length; t++){
            if(typeof(array[i][t]) != "object"){
                console.log("Not object");
                console.log(array[i][t]);
                return false
            }
            if(!(
                typeof(array[i][t].period) == "number" && 
                typeof(array[i][t].moduleCode) == "string" && 
                typeof(array[i][t].credits) == "number" && 
                typeof(array[i][t].name) == "string"
            )){
                console.log(array[i][t]);
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return true;
}

async function seedDB(){
    //clears database
    console.log("Started clearing database");
    await Promise.all(
        [staffMember, group, college, student].map(data => data.remove({}))
    )
    console.log("Finished clearing database");

    const moduleScrapping = execFile('python3',["getModules.py"], {maxBuffer: 1024 * 500}, async (error, stdout, stderr) => {
        if (error) throw error;
        console.log("Finished Python part of module scrapping");
        var dataArray = await convert3dArrayStringToOjbect(stdout);
        if(!dataArray){
            return;
        }
        college.create({
            name: "College of Engineering", 
            modules: dataArray[12]
        });

        console.log(arrayChecker(dataArray[1].concat(
            dataArray[2],dataArray[6],dataArray[7], 
            dataArray[9],dataArray[10],dataArray[11],dataArray[12], 
            dataArray[13],dataArray[14],dataArray[16],dataArray[21],
            dataArray[22],dataArray[23],dataArray[26],dataArray[27],
            dataArray[29],dataArray[32])));

        college.create({
            name: "College of Human and Health Sciences", 
            modules:    dataArray[1].concat(dataArray[2],dataArray[6],dataArray[7], 
                        dataArray[9],dataArray[10],dataArray[11],dataArray[12], 
                        dataArray[13],dataArray[14],dataArray[16],dataArray[21],
                        dataArray[22],dataArray[23],dataArray[26],dataArray[27],
                        dataArray[29],dataArray[32])
        }, (err) => {if (err) console.log(err);});
    });
}
module.exports = seedDB;//Of course you will need to adapt this to test it

Considering the JS code here are the first outputs of the program, the particularly bothering one, is the true output from the arrayCheck function, to be clear the first college.create works, while the second does not (of course you will need to remove the extra models to test, I have left them in case of the slight chance of there being an issue there):

The college schema:

var mongoose = require("mongoose");

var moduleSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
    period: Number,
    moduleCode: String,
    credits: Number,
    name: String,
    staff: [{
        type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId,
        ref: "staffMember"
    }],
    groups: [{
        type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId,
        ref: "group"
    }]
});

var collegeSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
    name: String,
    modules: [moduleSchema],
    staff: [{
        type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId,
        ref: "staffMember"
    }],
});

module.exports = mongoose.model("college", collegeSchema);

The Python code (although I'm almost certain this is not relevant to the error, it will be necessary for proper testing):

import urllib.request
import urllib.parse

def stripTag(element):
    return element.split('>',1)[-1].replace("<" + element.split('<')[-1], "")

def getModuleData(module):
    modulesHolder = module.split('>')
    moduleHolder = []
    for i in range(2,9,3):
        moduleHolder.append(stripTag(modulesHolder[i]))
    moduleHolder.append(stripTag(modulesHolder[10]))
    if moduleHolder[0] == "TB1":
        moduleHolder[0] = 1
    elif moduleHolder[0] == "TB2":
        moduleHolder[0] = 2
    elif moduleHolder[0] == "YR":
        moduleHolder[0] = 3
    elif moduleHolder[0] == "TB1+2":
        moduleHolder[0] = 4
    else:
        moduleHolder[0] = -1

    return moduleHolder

headers = {}
headers['User-Agent'] = "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686)"
url = "https://intranet.swan.ac.uk/catalogue/default.asp?type=modbydept&dept=any&ayr=18/19&detailOnly=false"
request = urllib.request.Request(url, headers=headers)
page = urllib.request.urlopen(request).read().decode("utf8").split("\n")

allModulesData = [[]]

for line in page:
    if line[:3] == "<h2" and len(allModulesData) > 0:
        allModulesData.append([])
    if line[:3] == "<tr" and line[18:25].strip().strip('\'') == "module":
        allModulesData[len(allModulesData) - 1].append(getModuleData(line))

print(allModulesData)
